person.education: Masters of Arts in English (Science and Technology Research Stream) at University of British Columbia, Vancouver, British Columbia.
Bachelor of Arts (Honours with distinction) in English and Women's Studies (minor) at University of Victoria, Victoria, British Columbia.

listBibl.bibl: Jenstad, Janelle, and Joseph Takeda (50%). "Making the RA Matter: Pedagogy, Interface, and Practices." Making Humanities Matter. Ed. Jentery Sayers. Minnesota: University of Minnesota Press. Peer reviewed. Forthcoming. Expected publication: 2017.
Takeda, Joseph. "The MoEML Finding Aid to the Bills of Mortality." The Map of Early Modern London. Ed. Janelle Jenstad. University of Victoria. Forthcoming.

Project documentation and numerous encyclopedia articles on London places authored, co-authored, and edited for The Map of Early Modern London, including: "Barbican," and "Wood Street." For a full list of my contributions to MoEML, see http://mapoflondon.uvic.ca/TAKE1.htm.
Takeda, Joseph. "Viewing Jewish and Trans Identity: History, Genetics, and Jill Solowayâ€™s Transparent." Qualicum History conference. Parksville, British Columbia. January 28, 2017.

Jenstad, Janelle, Tye Landels-Gruenewald, and Joseph Takeda (33%). "How To Do Things with 6000 Toponyms." How To Do Things with Millions Of Words conference. University of British Columbia. November 03, 2016.

item.p: Taught XPath Workshop in the role of Instructor (2016-02-24).
Taught ENGL 362, "Popular Literature in the Renaissance" in the role of Guest Lecturer (2016-02-03).
Taught SLST 481, "Existence and Anxiety in Dostoevsky" in the role of Guest Lecturer (2015-01-29).
Junior Programmer/Research Assistant at Endings.Supervised by Martin Holmes. (2016-05 to present. )
Junior Programmer/Consultant at The Map of Early Modern London.Supervised by Martin Holmes and Janelle Jenstad. (2015-05 to present. )
Assistant to the Coordinating Editor at Scene Performance Journal, The Internet Shakespeare Editions.Supervised by Janelle Jenstad. (2016-02-2016-05)
Research Assistant at The Internet Shakespeare Editions.Supervised by Michael Best. (2014-08-2016-02)
